utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey Pheebs?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m having dinner with my dad tomorrow night, do you wanna come?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Sure. Yeah, he’s kinda sexy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no, no, I’ll be there too.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay so, we’ll just come up with some kind of signal if it’s going well you can take off.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No Phoebe! I just need you there for support. I haven’t told him I’m pregnant yet.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh. Why not?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: ‘Cause I know he’s gonna flip out and I hate it when he’s angry.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh Rachel, this is all so ‘Papa don’t preach.’

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What Phoebe? Wait! One time he caught me smoking he said if he ever saw me doing that again he’d make me eat the entire pack.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! Oh well, I will be there!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Gosh. I’m not gonna let that man make you eat your baby. Oh. Hey! Who is that guy? I think I know him.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No you don’t!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No you don’t.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God!!! Monica!! He’s the stripper from your bachelorette party!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Her what?!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Your secret bachelorette party…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You had a bachelorette party?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: She untied his G-string with her teeth. Somebody stop me!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I thought we weren’t gonna have bachelor/bachelorette parties! Y’know, we agreed that it was a silly tradition.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It’s a grand tradition!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m sorry, they surprised me. There was nothing I could do!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well you could’ve untied it with your hands.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: This is so unfair! The one thing I wanted to do was throw my best friend a bachelor party, but no, I wasn’t allowed to. All I got was a stupid steak dinner!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You went home with the waitress.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah, that was a pretty good night.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I can’t believe you didn’t tell me! You know that the two pillars of marriage are openness and honesty!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ugh, I knew giving you that book was gonna come back and bite me in the ass!

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: How about I order everyone the Moroccan chicken?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I-I don’t eat meat.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: It’s chicken.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I don’t eat that either.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: I’ll never understand you lesbians. So baby, tell me…what is new with you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well actually umm…

utterance.speaker: Waiter
utterance.content: Your ’74 Lafite sir.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: ’74?! I ordered the ’75! That’s a magnificent wine! The ’74 is sewage! Why would you bring me sewage?! Is that a hard question? Are you an idiot? Is that why you’re a waiter?

utterance.speaker: Waiter
utterance.content: This is why I told the manager I wouldn’t wait on you tonight!

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: Oh come on! Don’t be such a baby!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: In case you didn’t notice, that is a scary man.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: He’s right though, the ’74 is absolute piss.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: This was such a huge mistake. I can’t tell him Phoebe. I can’t, I can’t, I can’t, I can’t…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No it’s okay, this is what’s gonna happen. I’m gonna wait a couple years and then the baby will tell him.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why, so he can get mad at the baby?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, that is the…baby’s problem. Oh, everything okay with the waiter?

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: I have no idea, I went to the bathroom. So sweetie, you were starting to tell me what is uh, what is new with you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well… Umm, I got TiVo.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: What’s TiVo?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It’s slang for pregnant.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: Are you really pregnant?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well uh, yes and no. Except not no. So to sum it up, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: Who is the father? Oh no! Please don’t tell me it’s her!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, it’s Ross. It’s Ross. You like Ross. Oh daddy, I hope you’re okay with all of this. I mean think about it, this is a good thing. You’re gonna—This is your first grandchild! You’re gonna be a poppy!

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: That’s true.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: Poppy. Oh, I’m gonna be a poppy. So when is the wedding?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: The wedding! There’s going to be a wedding. Young lady, don’t you sit there and tell me my first grandchild is going to be a bastard! Rachel Karen Green, tell me there is gonna be a wedding!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: February 2nd!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: So it was really cool seeing you lecture today.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh thanks. Although it kinda seemed like you were falling asleep there a little.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Oh no-no, I-I had my eyes closed so I could concentrate and y’know take it all in.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, a lot of my students do that.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: So, I gotta get going.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, I-I’ll see you tonight.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, bye.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Oh hey, thanks again for showing me your semi-precious stone collection. It was amazing!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: My God! You must be good in bed!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So uh, you and Mona, been a while now. How’s it going?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ah, it’s good. It’s going good. I mean, we get along great. She’s, she’s so…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hot?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I was gonna say sweet, but yeah-huh!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: She’s okay with Rachel and the baby?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well I…I haven’t actually told her yet. I don’t want to scare her off, y’know?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, you have to honest with her! Otherwise you may think that you’re going down the same path, but you’re really going down different ones.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m gonna take that book and beat you to death with it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God! You are gonna love me so much! I felt really bad about the whole bachelorette party thing, so tonight you’re gonna have a bachelor party.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, I got this number from this guy at work and I hired a stripper to come dance for you. Am I going in the wife hall of fame or what?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Honey! That’s crazy! I don’t want you to get me a stripper…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Will you let the lady talk?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Come on! Come on, it’ll be fun! It’ll make me feel so much better.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, I appreciate it, but uh, it’s a little creepy. Y’know? I’m not a bachelor anymore.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So don’t think of it as a bachelor party, think of it as a…a two month anniversary present.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sure, one year is paper, but two months is lapdance!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Please! I feel so bad! Just watch the hot woman get naked!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right fine! But I’m only doing this for you!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And Joey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thank you. All right, now who else do you want to invite?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ah, no-no-no just Ross. Ross and Joey is embarrassing enough.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh actually, sorry I can’t even make it. I’m seeing Mona again tonight.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I understand: who would cancel an actual date to go to a fake bachelor party?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m sorry I gotta cancel tonight baby…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m sorry I won’t be able to make it to your imaginary wedding, but I’m really busy that day. Yeah, I already have a unicorn baptism and a leprechaun bar mitzvah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know. I know. I panicked, I panicked. I didn’t want him to start yelling at me like I was some ’74 Latour.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It’s Lafite. The ’74 Latour is actually drinking quite nicely.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right here he comes. I’m gonna do this, I’m gonna tell him, I’m gonna be strong.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: I just called a friend of mine.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: I think I may be able to book The Plaza on short notice.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?! The Plaza?!! Oh daddy!! Right. Daddy, I need to talk to you. Please, sit down.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: What is it sweetie?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: There’s not gonna be a wedding. Ross and I are not getting married.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m sorry daddy.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: I don’t believe this!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh now daddy, stay calm. Please.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: Stay calm?!! How do you expect me to stay calm?! This is unacceptable Rachel! And I wanna know why?!! Is it because that punk Ross won’t marry you?! That’s it! Is that it?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes. Yes, he says I’m damaged goods.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So you uh, nervous about getting married?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, look let’s pretend it’s a real bachelor party. Okay? Y’know? Before your wedding. Come on, it’ll be fun.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. I can’t believe tomorrow’s the big day.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How does it feel knowing you’re never gonna be with another woman again huh? Knowing you’re gonna have to wake up to the same face everyday until you finally have the sweet release of death.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You’re right, this is more fun.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s her! Okay, come on!

utterance.speaker: Stripper
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Stripper
utterance.content: So which one of you lucky boys is Chandler?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, that-that’s-that’s me!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Joey Tribbiani, a big fan.

utterance.speaker: Stripper
utterance.content: So is that a bedroom?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah right over there.

utterance.speaker: Stripper
utterance.content: All right, whenever you’re ready.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That was weird.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why-why would she go in the bedroom?

utterance.speaker: Stripper
utterance.content: I’m waiting.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So she’s a…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s one naked hooker!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: I love your place! Where is this guy from?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh that’s an eighteenth century Indian artifact from Calcutta.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Oh wow! So, you’re more than just dinosaurs.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So much more.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Oh my God! Oh my God! I’m so sorry!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Aw forget it, it’s from Pier One. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: You think you can knock up my daughter and then not marry her?! I’m gonna kill you!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know this is actually not a great time for me.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: So? Come on! Explain yourself Geller! First you get my Rachel pregnant!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: You got Rachel pregnant?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Who did?!

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: You did!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes. Yes, yes I did. But-but it was, it was just a one night thing. It meant nothing.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: Oh? Really? That’s what my daughter means to you? Nothing?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No! No sir umm, she means a lot to me. I mean, I care—I-I love Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh but not that way. I mean…I mean I’m not in love with her. I love her like a, like a friend.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: Oh really? That’s how treat a friend? You get her in trouble and then refuse to marry her?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! I offered to marry her!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Wh…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: But I didn’t want to.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: Well why not? So you can spend your time with this tramp?!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Tramp?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Dr. Green, Mona. Mona, Dr. Green.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I can’t believe there is a naked hooker in there!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wait! Wait! Maybe she’s a hooker and a stripper, but she got confused about what she’s supposed to do.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Could be. I mean technically she did strip, we just, we just missed it. Ma’am, are you also a stripper?

utterance.speaker: Hooker
utterance.content: Uh, no. But I could pretend to strip, but that’s gonna cost extra. Okay, here’s the extras, handcuffs, spanking…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Maybe Monica’s playing a joke on ya. Y’know? Getting her own husband a hooker, that’s pretty funny.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That is funny, maybe for my birthday she’ll murder someone.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I bet Ross was in on it too. I mean he was conveniently busy.

utterance.speaker: Hooker
utterance.content: Do you mind if I smoke in here?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh actually, I’d rather you…Yeah, go ahead. We’re gonna have to burn that room down anyway.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: How could you have kept all of this from me?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I was going to tell you, but…

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: But what?! You figured you’d get what you wanted and then dump her like you dumped Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! I did not dump Rachel! Nor are we still together. Can I just… Why don’t we just let the machine get that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Ross. It’s Joey. There’s a hooker over here and we thought maybe you’d know something about it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No! No! No! No! No! I-I-I-I—I need to, I need to lie down.

utterance.speaker: Stu
utterance.content: So, tonight’s the night of the big bachelor party?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah! Hey! Thanks for getting me that girl’s number.

utterance.speaker: Stu
utterance.content: No problem. So who’s the party for?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: My husband.

utterance.speaker: Stu
utterance.content: You hired your husband a hooker?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She’s a stripper.

utterance.speaker: Stu
utterance.content: No, she’s a hooker.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Is that, is that what they call strippers sometimes?

utterance.speaker: Stu
utterance.content: When they’re hookers.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God Stu! I-I can’t believe you did this! Now are you absolutely sure she’s a hooker?

utterance.speaker: Stu
utterance.content: Either that or she’s just the best, most expensive date I ever had.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Maybe she meant to get you a hooker.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why would she do that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Maybe she wants you to learn something. Huh? Now is there anything you’re really bad at y’know, sexually?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: This is the worst bachelor party ever!

utterance.speaker: Hooker
utterance.content: What’s taking you boys so long?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: In a minute!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: In a minute? What’s gonna happen in a minute?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, all right maybe-maybe you should just ask her to leave.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why me?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! It’s your bachelor party.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Which is why you should do it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t want to. You do it!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You do it!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You do it!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right Rock, Paper, Scissors who has to tell the whore to leave! What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I miss this.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t think we’ve actually done this before!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, I-I miss hanging out with you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well we…we still hang out.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Not like we used to. Remember? You and me used to be inseparable. Y’know now it’s like…things are different.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well y’know, things are different. I’m…I’m married now.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh sure—And hey, don’t get me wrong, I am so happy for you guys. I just…I miss…hanging out…just-just us, y’know?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I miss that too. I tell you what; from now on we’ll make time to hang out with each other.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You got it. Come here.

utterance.speaker: Hooker
utterance.content: Oh God! Listen, I am this close to robbing you guys.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She’s a hooker! She’s a hooker! She’s a… Hi! Uh, we spoke on the phone.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So your dad dropped by. He’s a pleasant man!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’d better go. Just over here: I don’t want to miss the fight.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross I’m so sorry. Okay. I-I will promise I will straighten this out with him tomorrow in person, or via e-mail.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don’t care about your dad! I care about Mona! She was there and now she’s totally freaked out!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh okay, I’ll fix that to. What’s her e-mail address?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, I promise. I’ll fix this. I swear. I’ll-I’ll-I’ll-I’ll talk to her.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s it?! You call that a fight? Come on! "We were on a break!" "No we weren’t!" What happened to you two?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thank you so much for coming back over.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Oh good, you’re here. Yeah, and I was worried that it was going to be uncomfortable.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know Mona, just hear me out. First of all, I’m so sorry about my father yelling at you, but I heard you totally held your own. You’re gonna have to tell me how you did that.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Focus.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Um…But—Okay, yes Ross and I used to date. And yes we are gonna have a baby. But we are definitely not getting back together.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: How can I be sure on that?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh we just—we drove each other crazy!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I mean he was possessive, he was jealous, he could never just let the little things go!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Trying to date this woman.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Right! But, none of that compared to how kind and-and how gentle and thoughtful he is.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Probably shouldn’t touch me.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Y’know, I-I-I just…I don’t want to get in the middle of something so complicated.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know, I get it, but Mona, what relationship is not complicated? I mean we all have our baggage! You must too! Why else would you still be single? I am so gonna leave right now.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Should I leave this open for you too?

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: I’m not sure yet. Why didn’t you just tell me about all this?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Because what’s going on with Rachel has nothing to do with how I feel about you.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Yeah? Well you still shoulda told me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know and I was going to, but I thought it was better that you heard it from Rachel’s father. Look I…I made a mistake, but it’s only because I really, really like you. Really!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Okay, I guess you can…close the door now.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Forgot my purse! Oh, you guys made up. He’s a good kisser isn’t he? I’m going!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I swear I didn’t know she was a hooker! I mean wh—Did you let her smoke in here?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Her ass print is still on your grandmother’s quilt, do you really want to talk about smoking?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y’know what? I’m gonna make this up to you. I promised you a stripper , and you’re gonna get a stripper.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Monica! Wait!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Carry on.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ooh, these tennis shoes are so tight. I think I’ll take them off.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Could you not narrate?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Gotcha sailor.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: …just because you’re not in love with the guy you can’t…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow, you told your dad the truth.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: About an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wanna go see a movie?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes! Bye daddy.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Green
utterance.content: …there’s gonna be a wedding! That’s unacceptable Rachel! What the hell does love have to do with it anyway?! There are more important things in a marriage other than love! …constantly thinking about things! You have to think about the consequences of your decision.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! I do too think about the consequences of my decisions! What gives you the right to… Go to hell! Stupid guy on my phone.
